intro: Plagiobothrys tenuifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Plagiobothrys tenuifolius is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes.
